name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Brian RAAB, Appellee

pin_cites.parenthetical: stating "hearsay evidence is considered valid information in testing probable cause to arrest"
stating "hearsay evidence is considered valid information in testing probable cause to arrest"

judges: BEFORE: CAPPY, C.J., and CASTILLE, SAYLOR, EAKIN, BAER, BALDWIN and FITZGERALD, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Brian RAAB, Appellee.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 20th day of November, 2007, the order of the Superior Court is REVERSED. See Commonwealth v. Dickerson, 468 Pa. 599, 364 A.2d 677, 682 (1976) (stating “hearsay evidence is considered valid information in testing probable cause to arrest”); see also Commonwealth v. Stokes, 480 Pa. 38, 389 A.2d 74, 77 (1978); Pa.R.E. 104(a).
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Karen Ann Diaz, Esq., Diane E. Gibbons, Esq., Doylestown, for Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Neils C. Eriksen, Jr., Esq., for Brian Raab.
casebody.head_matter:
934 A.2d 695
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Brian RAAB, Appellee.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Nov. 20, 2007.
Karen Ann Diaz, Esq., Diane E. Gibbons, Esq., Doylestown, for Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Neils C. Eriksen, Jr., Esq., for Brian Raab.
BEFORE: CAPPY, C.J., and CASTILLE, SAYLOR, EAKIN, BAER, BALDWIN and FITZGERALD, JJ.
